title: Drought hit to force up food prices
text:
Scott Donald is nervous that the drought could mean rising food prices within the next 6 months at his organic grocery store Wray Organic at Cleveland in Brisbane.

"We haven't seen it just yet but the knock on effect will come soon," Mr Donald said.

"I have been talking to growers now and they say this season is way down so high prices will come through next season."

Scott Donald thinks that food prices might rise soon. AFR

The latest inflation figures show fruit prices fell 3.1 per cent in the September quarter with vegetable prices down 2.5 per cent.

But overall food prices have risen 0.4 per cent in the quarter and show an annual growth rate at 2.3 per cent - roughly the same pace of growth of wages in Australia.
description: Scott Donald is nervous that the drought could mean rising food prices within the next 6 months at his organic grocery store Wray Organic in Cleveland Brisbane.
